implementation.name: App
implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: Main UI component that manages the task list, handles opening the form for adding/editing, and connects UI actions to API calls for add, edit, delete, and mark as completed/pending.
implementation.pseudo_code:
On mount:
    Fetch all tasks from backend and store in state
When user clicks '+ Add Task':
    Open TaskForm with no initialTask
When user clicks 'Edit' on a task:
    Open TaskForm with initialTask set to the selected task
When TaskForm submits:
    If editingTask is set:
        Call handleUpdateTask (update existing task via API)
    Else:
        Call handleCreateTask (add new task via API)
When user clicks 'Delete' on a task:
    Call handleDeleteTask (delete task via API)
When user clicks 'Done'/'Undo' on a task:
    Call handleToggleComplete (toggle completed status via API)
Display filtered and sorted tasks using TaskItem

implementation.name: TaskForm
implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: Form component for adding or editing a task. Collects Title, Description, Priority, Due date, and Category (used as Tag). On submit, passes the data to the parent handler.
implementation.pseudo_code:
Display form fields:
    Title (required)
    Description (optional)
    Priority (Low/Medium/High)
    Category (used as Tag, optional)
    Due Date (optional)
On submit:
    Validate required fields
    Call onSubmit with all field values

implementation.name: TaskItem
implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: Displays a single task with buttons to edit, delete, and toggle completion. Calls parent handlers for these actions.
implementation.pseudo_code:
Display task attributes (title, description, priority, category, due date)
Show 'Done' or 'Undo' button depending on completed status
Show 'Edit' and 'Delete' buttons
On 'Done'/'Undo' click:
    Call onToggleComplete
On 'Edit' click:
    Call onEdit
On 'Delete' click:
    Confirm and call onDelete

implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: Displays each task and provides a button to toggle its status between Completed and Pending. Calls the onToggleComplete handler when the button is clicked. Visually reflects the current state with line-through and faded card for completed tasks.
implementation.name: TaskItem
implementation.pseudo_code:
FOR each task:
  Render task details
  Render a button labeled 'Done' if not completed, 'Undo' if completed
  WHEN button is clicked:
    CALL onToggleComplete(task)
  IF task.completed:
    Show line-through and faded card

implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: Implements the handleToggleComplete function, which updates the task's completed status by calling the API and reloads the task list. Passes this handler to TaskItem for toggling.
implementation.name: App
implementation.pseudo_code:
DEFINE handleToggleComplete(task):
  CALL api.updateTask(task.id, {...task, completed: !task.completed})
  CALL loadTasks() to refresh UI
PASS handleToggleComplete to TaskItem

implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: Sends a PUT request to the backend to update the task's completed status. Used by App's handleToggleComplete.
implementation.name: api.updateTask
implementation.pseudo_code:
FUNCTION updateTask(id, task):
  SEND PUT request to /tasks/{id} with updated task data
  RETURN updated task

implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: Defines the /tasks/{task_id} PUT endpoint, which updates a task's status in the backend using the database module.
implementation.name: update_task
implementation.pseudo_code:
ENDPOINT PUT /tasks/{task_id}:
  CALL database.update_task(task_id, task)
  IF updated_task is None:
    RAISE 404 error
  RETURN updated_task

implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: Updates the task's completed status in persistent storage. Called by the backend endpoint.
implementation.name: update_task
implementation.pseudo_code:
FUNCTION update_task(task_id, task_update):
  FOR each task in tasks:
    IF task.id == task_id:
      updated_task = Task(id=task_id, **task_update)
      REPLACE task with updated_task
      SAVE tasks
      RETURN updated_task
  RETURN None

missing_implementations: Validation for all required attributes (title, description, priority, due date, tag/category) is not enforced in backend; only 'title' is required by frontend form and backend model, but others are optional.
If any required attribute except 'title' is missing, the backend does not reject the creation request.
Backend does not validate that all specified fields are present before storing the task.
The attribute 'tag' is referred to as 'category' in code, but the requirement uses 'tag'; this mapping is not explicitly documented or enforced.

implementation.name: App.handleDeleteTask
implementation.pseudo_code:
When onDelete(task.id) is called from TaskItem:
    Call api.deleteTask(id)
    If successful:
        Remove task from local state
    Else:
        Show error message

    If response not OK:
        Throw error

implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: FastAPI endpoint that receives DELETE requests for a task ID, calls the database delete function, and returns success or error.
implementation.name: DELETE /tasks/{task_id}
implementation.pseudo_code:
On DELETE /tasks/{task_id}:
    Call database.delete_task(task_id)
    If not success:
        Raise 404 error
    Else:
        Return success message

implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: Database function that removes the task with the given ID from the persistent store (tasks.json). Returns True if deleted, False if not found.
implementation.name: database.delete_task
implementation.pseudo_code:
delete_task(task_id):
    Load all tasks
    Remove task with matching ID
    Save updated task list
    Return True if a task was deleted, else False
